description.narrative: By 2022, the Ministry of Economy and Finance, the National Secretariat of Planning and Development and other decentralized ministries and autonomous governments have strengthened their systems to monitor investment in children and adolescents at the national and local levels, to measure multidimensional child poverty and to improve social protection, with an emphasis on emergency situations.

mailing-address.narrative: Av. Amazonas 2889 y La Granja Edificio Naciones Unidas Quito

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Situation Analysis or Update on women and children

title.narrative: Ecuador United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Ecuador Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Equity for Children)
UNICEF Programmes in Ecuador (Maternal and Child Health)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the Ministry of Economy and Finance, the National Secretariat of Planning and Development and other decentralized ministries and autonomous governments have strengthened their systems to monitor investment in children and adolescents at the national and local levels, to measure multidimensional child poverty and to improve social protection, with an emphasis on emergency situations.

description.narrative: UNICEF Country Office contributed to develop a methodology for measuring child multidimensional poverty, while advocating for the right of migrant population to access social services and social protection. Additionally, UNICEF Ecuador developed an innovative cash-based programme to support children and adolescents on the move | Status:On-track | As-of Date:21/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of documents analyzing social and economic policies impacting on children and adolescents.

actual.value: 2019:A document showing children poverty and the need of a social protection system was developed and released in January 2020.

title.narrative: Reports on child and adolescent social investment

actual.value: 2019:Initial steps were taken with other UN agencies and an academic institution to measure social investment in Ecuador.

title.narrative: National government measurement of child poverty using multidimensional measures

baseline.value: Ecuador does not count with a methodology to measure multidimensional poverty on children.

actual.value: 2019:Methodology validated and published in the NSO methodological journal
